body_content.explanation: part of a turkey or other large bird cooked in an oven and eaten as food that includes the breast (= chest parts), but not the legs:
examples: Supermarkets have seen a strong increase in demand for turkey crown roasts this Christmas.
A crown roast will cook more quickly and should fit in any oven, and your roasting tin.

body_content.explanation: a large piece of meat from a pig or lamb (= young sheep) that is prepared to look like a crown (= head covering worn by a king or queen) and cooked in an oven:
examples: As with all riojas it goes beautifully with lamb dishes such as crown roast and Lancashire hotpot.
You can stuff a crown roast of pork, or you can cook the stuffing separately.
